column4: hey - i rebooted after doing a patch (prompted by ubuntu) and now X won't start :( something about a mismatch of nvidia versions?
i'm using the command line irc from a GUI-less shell :(
you upgraded your kernel right?  you'll need to reinstall the nvidia driver probably.
did you use envy to install the vid driver the first time?
were you using the binary blob drivers (the ones straight from nvidia's website)?
I would recommend grabbing envy, it'll take care of it for you
yep.  do you have lynx or elinks (text based web browser) installed?
hold a moment... let me just get you a wget line.  makes life easier :)
wget http://albertomilone.com/ubuntu/nvidia/scripts/envy_0.8.2-0ubuntu1_all.deb
nt :)
http://albertomilone.com/ubuntu/nvidia/scripts/envy_0.8.2-0ubuntu1_all.deb
you didn't have the http:// part, which is required for wget...
I'll try just sending it to ya.  it's small.
ahh, good point lol
so much easier now!
thousands of small korean children banging away on OLPCs to rewrite the drivers for you.  I love it!
but will it be translated to english? O.o
do you have a textual e-mail client per chance?  I could just e-mail you the .deb, it's all of 100k, and as I said, does EVERYTHING for you
oh god... duh of the month... or you could boot your livecd, and just get it that way :)
or, reboot right quick into the old kernel too!
yeah.  just reboot, choose the old kernel, work normally, and pull that file, install.  reboot again, and run envy, and be perfectly set :)
